newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cargolux alters Hong Kong flight skeds.
newsitem.headline: Cargolux alters Hong Kong flight skeds.

text.p: Cargolux has changed its ex-Hong Kong flight schedule for a trial period because of slot congestion at Kai Tai, according to the airline's district manager for Hong Kong, Macau and Guangzhou, Patrick Ng.

Instead of the twice weekly all-cargo flights on Wednesday and Fridays leaving at around 0900, departure is now around 2100 and the routing has also been changed which means a reduction in ex-Hong Kong payload,Ng said.

Instead of flying Hong Kong, Bangkok, Abu Dhabi and Luxembourg, Cargolux now flies direct to Abu Dhabi and calls at Bangkok on the return leg. Cargolux operate either one of four Boeing 747-200s or one of three Boeing 747-400s for the Hong Kong service.

"There is a payload penalty of around 10-15 tonnes. But the departure 12 hours later than normal is a better timing for our aircraft rotation and means flights will stay on time. It was also help us cope with cargo arriving from China in the afternoon giving shippers a more convenient transit time," Ng said.
The trial period is expected for the next month when a long term decision will be made, he added. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel:+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
